intro: Coespeletia thyrsiformis f. marcanoana, commonly known as the Marcanoana thyrsoform Coespeletia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its distinctive, spiny stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its botanical features make it a unique and resilient species within its ecological niche.
